articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets CPC Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets CPC Delegation
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China led by its Head Wang Jiarui at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 Present there were Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Xiaoming.
					
					 Kim Yong Il said that the Chinese party and people achieved many successes and further raised the international prestige of the country last year under the leadership of General Secretary Hu Jintao. 
					
					 He hoped the Chinese people would make a greater advance in their efforts to implement the tasks advanced by the 17th Congress of the CPC.
					
					 Wang noted that the successes gained by the DPRK in the economic construction last year were possible thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il who wisely led the Korean people by providing ceaseless field guidance to different fields.
					
					 He stressed that the Korean people are filled with the zeal to bring about a new great revolutionary surge and open the gate to a great prosperous powerful nation in 2012, the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets CPC Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets CPC Delegation
Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Thursday met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China led by its Head Wang Jiarui.
					 The head of the delegation said that this year marks the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between China and the DPRK. The friendly relations between the two parties and the two countries of China and the DPRK provided by the revolutionaries of the elder generation are steadily growing stronger under the deep care of General-Secretary Hu Jintao and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, he noted.
					
					 He mentioned that the Chinese party and government are grateful to the party and government of the DPRK for having extended support and encouragement to various events held in China last year.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Indian Embassy Officials Held
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Indian Embassy Officials Held
Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with staff members of the Indian embassy here was held at the DPRK-India Friendship Pyongyang Leather Shoes Factory on Thursday on the occasion of the day of the Republic of India.
					 Present there on invitation were Zile Singh, Indian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 On hand were Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is vice-chairman of the DPRK-India Friendship Association, officials concerned and officials of the factory.
					
					 After being briefed on the history of the factory associated with the immortal leadership exploits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the participants looked round several production processes.
					
					 They appreciated a performance agitating increased production given by an itinerant art squad of the factory and deepened the feelings of friendship, talking about further developing the relations between the DPRK and India.

articles.title: New Poems Rousing People to Implement Joint Editorial
articles.content:
New Poems Rousing People to Implement Joint Editorial
Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Poems have been written in the DPRK to call the entire people to a fresh revolutionary upsurge from the outset of the new year.
					Poets of the Central Committee of the Korean Writers Union have written many poems strongly appealing to the hearts of all the people from the first days of the new year out of the desire to glorify this year as a year of a new revolutionary upsurge, sounding the bugle of general advance.
					
					"Motherland, forward in the general advance!", "Flaming Glow over Kangson", "Soldiers stand at frontal breakthrough for general offensive", "Our flames", "It's time for our strength to erupt" and "Ye youth, flare up" and other poems reflect the realities sensitively and are overflowing with strong appeal and militancy. They powerfully inspire the working people in the gigantic work for the building of a great, prosperous and powerful nation. 
					
					Poets who greeted the morning of the New Year in Kangson, a historic land, watched the thrilling scene of the flow of molten iron from the UHP electric arc furnace of Korean-style and wrote the stirring poems "Torchlight in Kangson", "Leap higher, ye flames of upsurge" and "He came in December", which inflame the hearts of the smelters with the ardor of creation and leap forward in making a breach on the main front of economic power.
					
					They rushed to production sites aflame with a new revolutionary upswing such as the Pyongyang Thermal-power Complex and the Pyongyang Textile Mill where they wrote "The first step in the new year", "Familiar faces" and "You are like heroine Ri Hwa Sun" and many other poems pulsating with the breath of the Songun era and giving a profound philosophical rendition to the socialist life.

articles.title: 1,000-ri Journey of Revolution Covered by President in Teenage
articles.content:
1,000-ri Journey of Revolution Covered by President in Teenage
Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung set out on the 1,000-ri journey for national liberation on January 22, Juche 14 (1925).
					True to the will of his father Kim Hyong Jik, he had come to and studied in the motherland. One day of January that year he heard that his father had been arrested again by the Japanese police.
					
					He, who determined to fight a life and death struggle to avenge his father and the Korean nation, started out on the journey at the age of 13.
					
					He took a train from Pyongyang to Kaechon and walked all along in the face of inclement snowstorms of the northern area.
					
					On February 3, the thirteenth day following he left his dear native home with a firm resolution to win back the ruined country at any cost, he arrived at Phophyong Ferry. He looked back at mountains and streams in the motherland over and again with sorrow and indignation.
					
					He walked slowly towards the opposite side of the river singing the "Song of the River Amnok" and made a firm resolve not to return home before he won the independence of Korea.
					
					True to his resolve, he waged the sanguinary anti-Japanese war for 20 years, thus accomplishing the historic cause of national liberation.
					
					Every year lots of school youth and children make an expedition march along the 1,000-ri-long route of revolution covered by the President.
					
					The expedition march has been participated in by nearly one million school youth and children from different parts of the country over last three-odd decades since the first "1,000-ri Journey for National Liberation" expedition march was conducted with the attendance of more than 10,000 school youth and children in January 1975.
					
					The new generations of Korea are launching the expedition march with the steel-like resolution to make a long journey for building a great, prosperous and powerful nation in the spirit of the 1,000-ri journey of revolution.

articles.title: DPRK Determined to Wipe Out Enemy
articles.content:
DPRK Determined to Wipe Out Enemy
Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The hearts of the entire army and people of Korea are aflame with indignation and hatred for the imprudent anti-DPRK confrontational racket of traitor Lee Myung Bak and his group upon receiving the statement of the spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army.
					 KPA General Pang Kwan Bok said that Lee Myung Bak and his group, who had totally denied the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and driven the north-south relations flowing forcefully toward reconciliation, unity and reunification into a crisis of total severance, unhesitatingly blustered it was impossible to improve the north-south relations through cooperation from the outset of the new year, throwing away the mask of "dialogue" and "respect of declarations".
					
					 The KPA officers and men have been waiting for the time of punishment, watching with towering national indignation and hatred every crime-woven act of traitor Lee Myung Bak who is steeped in anti-national, anti-reunification and anti-DPRK moves from the very moment he took power.
					
					 The KPA officers and men, conscious of their mission for the time and their revolutionary duty in face of the current situation to which they can no longer remain an onlooker, will take an all-out confrontational posture to mercilessly knock down traitor Lee and his group and smash the confrontational moves of the anti-reunification forces against fellow countrymen.
					
					 Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said: If the enemy dare flout with our inviolable dignity and sovereignty, millions of our youth will crush the traitor group at one blow with the revolutionary sledge hammer which has been forged for more than a half century and totally uproot the hindrance to national reunification in this land.
					
					 The workers of the Chollima Steel Complex and other units are intensifying the increased production drive, saying the heedless confrontational frenzy of the traitor group to block the advance of the DPRK, seething with a new revolutionary upsurge is an unpardonable anti-reunification hysteria and it only makes them harden their faith, will and valor thousand-fold to uphold the Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea firmly. 
					
					 It is the unanimous will of the Korean people to show clearly to the world how the reckless anti-DPRK confrontational moves of the Lee Myung Bak traitor clique go to pieces in face of the DPRK standing in an all-out confrontation by making a revolutionary leap in the building of a great, prosperous and powerful socialist country with a rifle in one hand and a sickle or a hammer or a brush in the other.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Policy of Confrontation Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Policy of Confrontation Flayed
Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group is driving the inter-Korean relations to a more extreme phase, while insisting on its "policy towards the north" and advocating the provocative theory which calls on the north to make a change first.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 Shortly ago, traitor Lee in a " New Year address" talked the nonsense that he would "wait for the north to change its attitude, abiding by the principle" and "the north should opt for cooperation, away from its old behavior."
					
					 What Lee uttered is no more than an unpardonable provocation intended to shift the responsibility for the bedeviled inter-Korean relations onto the DPRK and pursue his treacherous policy of confrontation, persistently denying the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 It is none other than traitor Lee who should make a policy switchover, away from his policy of confrontation between the north and the south and it is again the group of traitors who should discard their posture of confrontation with fellow countrymen, away from their anachronistic old attitude as early as possible, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The development of the inter-Korean relations is absolutely impossible without respect for the above-said declarations. This is the need and call of the times and all Koreans.
					
					 The above-said theory the Lee group touted while trumpeting about what it called "principle" and "consistency" is nothing but an open declaration of its scenario to ignite a war against the north, persistently denying any improvement of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 If the Lee group is allowed to persist in its desperate and vicious moves to escalate the confrontation, opposed to the country's reunification, all Koreans will not be able to escape the disaster of a nuclear war.
					
					 The Lee group is bound to meet final destruction should it go mad with the moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK, going against the trend of the times without dropping its day-dream.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Outbursts Termed Hypocritical
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Outbursts Termed Hypocritical
Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Some days ago the south Korean "public prosecutor general" branded the just candlelight demonstrations staged by people last year as "illegal and violent" while crying out for "rooting out the pro-north leftist forces". He also blustered that "the establishment of a basic order for freedom and democracy" is the "most essential precondition for weathering economic difficulties". The minister of "Justice" and the director of the "Intelligence Service" vied with each other to shout hoarse that establishing a stringent "security system should be a precondition for "economic recovery" and "illegal acts should be strongly dealt with."
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a signed commentary:
					
					 Their reckless remarks mean that economy can be saved from a crisis only through the suppression of the people's struggle against Lee Myung Bak's unpopular misrule. This is no more than sheer sophism which can be let loose only by those hell-bent on treachery and fascism.
					
					 Their outbursts are a crafty and base plot to shift the blame for the serious economic crisis caused by their treacherous policy onto the people, the victims of it.
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that the Lee group has disclosed its ulterior intention to ruthlessly block the massive advance of the people from all walks of life calling for independence, democracy and reunification under the pretext of tiding over the "economic crisis".
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that the Lee Myung Bak regime is busy talking about "economic recovery" but, in actuality, it is no more than a "pragmatic fascist regime" keen to seek a way out in intensifying the fascist dictatorship, hell-bent only on "violating democracy and suppressing the reunification movement" and "deteriorating the people's living".
					
					 Fascist dictatorship can never be justified. Dictatorship is by no means a cure-all but the last-ditch effort of those driven into a tight corner.
					
					 No matter how desperately the Lee group tries to intensify fascist dictatorship, it is destined to go to ruin.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Pro-Japanese Behavior Slammed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Pro-Japanese Behavior Slammed
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Lee Myung Bak revealed his true colors as a quisling serving Japan at the recent "talks" with Japanese Prime Minister Aso. 
					 Minju Joson Thursday says in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 At the "talks" Lee refrained from mentioning Japan's acts of hurting the sovereignty and interests of the Korean nation such as its distortion of history and its moves to grab Tok Islet. This is an unpardonable pro-Japanese behavior of the traitor.
					
					 As far as Aso is concerned, he is a descendant of the family that drafted and kidnapped many young Koreans to Japan and bled them white during the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and the guy that whitewashed the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists over Korea. 
					
					 Lee, when meeting with Aso, was busying currying favor with the latter, asserting that "let bygones be bygones" and he would "pursue a "stable preservation and development" of the relations with Japan  instead of holding Japan accountable for its past crimes and denouncing its moves for reinvasion. When Aso raised "the north's nuclear issue" and "the abduction issue", Lee echoed his words by promising "support" and "cooperation." Not content with this, Lee went the lengths of uttering that he would join the new Administration of the U.S. in making "joint actions and responses" over the matters. 
					
					 By pleasing Aso Lee sought to garner support for his moves to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen rejected at home and abroad and thus get rid of his serious ruling crisis. 
					
					  How miserable Lee is as he invited Aso, the prime minister likely to be replaced any time, to visit south Korea and accorded him a red carpet treatment in a bid to weather the crisis with his help. If one depends on foreign forces with one's back turned on the nation, one is bound to do the same folly as Lee did. 
					
					 What do the "talks" held between Lee and Aso show?  This goes to prove that Koreans can never protect the dignity and sovereignty of the nation, improve the inter-Korean relations and escape from disasters as long as the Lee group is allowed to run riot to do harm against the compatriots in collusion with foreign forces.
